conversion_verification.notes: Second image is an angled cutaway/isometric render with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and exposed interior spaces due to roof/ceiling removal.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; good isometric view; cutaway is clean. Minor simplification at some wall junctions and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency largely match (bedroom cluster + baths near top/left, open living/kitchen center-right, alfresco right, garage front/right). Some proportional/layout deviations and simplified partitions/openings; exterior/entry/verandah/portico areas appear simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (multiple beds, living seating, dining tables, kitchen island). Bathrooms present but fixtures are simplified; some room-specific elements (e.g., theatre/study detailing) appear generalized.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render, good separation of walls/floors, interiors visible, minimal artifacts. Materials are consistent; background is uncluttered and no text labels.

detected_errors.description: Some room proportions and partition placements are simplified compared to the 2D plan (notably around entry/front rooms and some internal corridors).
Door/window opening sizes/placements are not fully verifiable and appear generalized (several openings rendered as simplified gaps/sliders).
Furniture is plausible but not consistently mapped to named rooms (e.g., theatre/study and wet-area fixture specificity is reduced).

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout correspondence, though several partitions/openings and some room proportions are simplified versus the 2D plan.
